definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Symptom heavy directly uses the original fluid.

sentences.english: For serious cases, will be handed over to the public security organs.

sentences.english: If oral intake of this product should be timely to induce vomiting, severe cases should be immediately to the hospital for medical treatment.

sentences.english: The badly wounded take priority for medical attention over those slightly hurt.

sentences.english: Wear and tear of tooth of the person that weigh, produce occlusive scar, can produce periodontosis to change.

sentences.english: Sometimes, AVMS might be associated with severe disfiguration, ulceration and bleeding.

sentences.english: Variation of ECG of serious case was obvious and its prognosis was bad.

sentences.english: Anaemic and serious person, eye ground is cadaverous most common.

sentences.english: In more severe cases, all the enamel may be damaged.
